articles.title: Six die in private plane crash in Haiti — World — The Guardian Nigeria News – Nigeria and World News - Guardian Nigeria
articles.description: Six people including two American missionaries were killed when a private airplane crashed southwest of Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince
articles.content: Six people including two American missionaries were killed when a private airplane crashed southwest of Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince, local authorities said Saturday.The aircraft had taken off from… [+1477 chars]

articles.author: Sporting News
articles.title: France and Manchester United star Pogba joins Burna Boy's birthday celebration in Miami - Goal.com
articles.description: Lionel Messi has never succeeded in leading Argentina to a Copa America triumph although he came close on a few occasions. At age 34, this could be his last chance to do it, although Brazil, the host of the competition, will likely stand in his way.

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.title: AP PHOTOS: US troops on front lines of America's longest war - Associated Press
articles.description: During the course of America’s longest war, more than 800,000 members of the U.S. military served in Afghanistan, a multigenerational fight against a tenacious insurgency. For the troops on the front lines, sometimes it meant holding a remote outpost as morta…

articles.author: CNA
articles.title: Freed American journalist remembers horrors of Myanmar junta jail - CNA
articles.description: FAIRFAX: Journalist Nathan Maung turned to meditation when he was jailed for reporting on Myanmar's bloody coup, but even back home in sleepy Virginia, he can't forget those left behind, including a colleague still at the mercy of their jailers.
